protocol_name: Plaque Assay for the Aureococcus anophagefferens Virus (AaV)
protocol_name_html: Plaque Assay for the Aureococcus anophagefferens Virus (AaV)
description:
We have developed a plaque assay for AaV with a modified protocol from Schroeder et. al 2002. 

 

 

Protocol modified from:

 

Schroeder, D.C., et al., Coccolithovirus (Phycodnaviridae): Characterisation of a new large dsDNA

algal virus that infects Emiliania huxleyi. Archives of Virology, 2002.147(9): p. 1685-1698.

groups.group_name: Protist Research to Optimize Tools in Genetics (PROT-G)
The Aquatic Microbial Ecology Research Group - AMERG (The Buchan, Zinser and Wilhelm labs)

components.data: Make ASP12A and autoclave. Do not add solutions after autoclaving.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Make ASP12A and autoclave. Do not add solutions after autoclaving.

components.data: Prepare Trace Metal Solutions I - III, Fe-EDTA Sodium Salt Solution, and Vitamin Solution. Add constituents to 750 mL MilliQ water, shake to dissolve. Add MilliQ water to 1.0 L. Filter sterilize. Trace Metal Solutions and Fe-EDTA Sodium Salt Solution are stored at 4ºC in 15 - 50 mL aliquots, while the Vitamin solution is stored at -20ºC in 5 - 10 mL aliquots.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Prepare Trace Metal Solutions I - III, Fe-EDTA Sodium Salt Solution, and Vitamin Solution. Add constituents to 750 mL MilliQ water, shake to dissolve. Add MilliQ water to 1.0 L. Filter sterilize. Trace Metal Solutions and Fe-EDTA Sodium Salt Solution are stored at 4ºC in 15 - 50 mL aliquots, while the Vitamin solution is stored at -20ºC in 5 - 10 mL aliquots.

components.data: Add anhydrous salts, hydrous salts, macronutrients and Tris Base to 75% desired MilliQ water while stirring to dissolve. Add MilliQ water to final volume, autoclave.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add anhydrous salts, hydrous salts, macronutrients and Tris Base to 75% desired MilliQ water while stirring to dissolve. Add MilliQ water to final volume, autoclave.

components.data: Once cooled, add in 1mL of the Trace Metal Solutions, Fe-EDTA Sodium Salt Solution, and Vitamin Solution per 1L of media made.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Once cooled, add in 1mL of the Trace Metal Solutions, Fe-EDTA Sodium Salt Solution, and Vitamin Solution per 1L of media made.

components.data: For bottom agar, add low melting agarose to ASP12 A for a final concentration of 1%. Sterilize by microwaving. Bring to a boil and let solidify. Repeat three times.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: For bottom agar, add low melting agarose to ASP12 A for a final concentration of 1%. Sterilize by microwaving. Bring to a boil and let solidify. Repeat three times.

components.data: Bottom Agar
components.name: Section

components.data: After third microwave sterilization, add vitamin solution and trace metal solutions after allowing to cool for 5 minutes. Pour (15 mL) into each Petri dish.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: After third microwave sterilization, add vitamin solution and trace metal solutions after allowing to cool for 5 minutes. Pour (15 mL) into each Petri dish.

components.data: Bottom Agar
components.name: Section

components.data: For top agar, add low melting agarose to ASP12A for a final concentration of 0.4%, sterilize by microwaving, then add vitamin  and trace metal solutions. Keep at 37º C if performing assay, otherwise let solidify.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: For top agar, add low melting agarose to ASP12A for a final concentration of 0.4%, sterilize by microwaving, then add vitamin  and trace metal solutions. Keep at 37º C if performing assay, otherwise let solidify.

components.data: Top Agar
components.name: Section

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 5 of Plaque Assay for AaV: Does time impact number of plaques produced?
source_data.protocol_name: Plaque Assay for the Aureococcus anophagefferens Virus (AaV)
source_data.protocol_name_html: Plaque Assay for the Aureococcus anophagefferens Virus (AaV)
source_data.annotation: Follow microwave sterilization process as listed above for bottom agar.
source_data.thread_text: Follow microwave sterilization process as listed above for bottom agar.
source_data.body: Follow microwave sterilization process as listed above for bottom agar.

components.data: Concentrate 1.0 L, week old Aureococcus by centrifugation (3400 x g for 2 minutes) at 20ºC.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Concentrate 1.0 L, week old Aureococcus by centrifugation (3400 x g for 2 minutes) at 20ºC.

components.data: Protocol for 25 Plaque Assays
components.name: Section

components.data: Resuspend to a total volume of (30 mL) in fresh ASP12A.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Resuspend to a total volume of (30 mL) in fresh ASP12A.

components.data: Protocol for 25 Plaque Assays
components.name: Section

components.data: Dilute virus (AaV) in fresh ASP12A.
components.name: Description

components.data: Protocol for 25 Plaque Assays
components.name: Section

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 7 of Plaque Assay for the Aureococcus anophagefferens Virus (AaV)
source_data.protocol_name: Plaque Assay for the Aureococcus anophagefferens Virus (AaV)
source_data.protocol_name_html: Plaque Assay for the Aureococcus anophagefferens Virus (AaV)
source_data.annotation: We use this approach to titre lysates, but it should work with other samples where a virus is suspected.
source_data.thread_text: We use this approach to titre lysates, but it should work with other samples where a virus is suspected.
source_data.body: We use this approach to titre lysates, but it should work with other samples where a virus is suspected.

components.data: Combine (0.9 mL) concentrated Aureococcus with (0.1 mL) diluted virus or control in 15 mL conical tube, invert to mix, and incubate with cap loosened at 19°C for 30 minutes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Combine (0.9 mL) concentrated Aureococcus with (0.1 mL) diluted virus or control in 15 mL conical tube, invert to mix, and incubate with cap loosened at 19°C for 30 minutes.

components.data: Protocol for 25 Plaque Assays
components.name: Section

components.data: Add 3 mL of 37°C top agar to 15 mL conical tube, invert to mix and pour on bottom agar.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 3 mL of 37°C top agar to 15 mL conical tube, invert to mix and pour on bottom agar.

components.data: Protocol for 25 Plaque Assays
components.name: Section

components.data: Once in plate, gently agitate top agar to ensure even coverage.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Once in plate, gently agitate top agar to ensure even coverage.

components.data: Protocol for 25 Plaque Assays
components.name: Section

components.data: Once the plate is solidified, move to a lighted incubator with appropriate light and temperature.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Once the plate is solidified, move to a lighted incubator with appropriate light and temperature.

components.data: Protocol for 25 Plaque Assays
components.name: Section

components.data: Allow to incubate at 19°C with a 14:10 light dark cycle (100 μE/m-2 s-2) for 11 days, face up, to allow plaques to develop.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Allow to incubate at 19°C with a 14:10 light dark cycle (100 μE/m-2 s-2) for 11 days, face up, to allow plaques to develop.

components.data: Protocol for 25 Plaque Assays
components.name: Section
